definition: the act of apprehending (especially apprehending a criminal), to contract
details:
noun
- the act of apprehending (especially apprehending a criminal)
= synonyms: apprehension
- the act of catching an object with the hands
= example: the act of catching an object with the hands
= synonyms: snap, grab, snatch
- a cooperative game in which a ball is passed back and forth
= example: a cooperative game in which a ball is passed back and forth
- a fastener that fastens or locks a door or window
- a restraint that checks the motion of something
= synonyms: stop
- a drawback or difficulty that is not readily evident
= example: a drawback or difficulty that is not readily evident
= synonyms: gimmick
- a break or check in the voice (usually a sign of strong emotion)
- anything that is caught, especially if it is worth catching
= example: anything that is caught, especially if it is worth catching
- a person regarded as a good matrimonial prospect
= synonyms: match
- the quantity that was caught
= example: the quantity that was caught
= synonyms: haul
verb
- to contract
= example: to contract
= synonyms: draw, flex
- to delay or hold up
- to be struck or affected by
= example: to be struck or affected by
- to grasp with the mind or develop an understanding of
= example: to grasp with the mind or develop an understanding of
= synonyms: get
- to detect a blunder or misstep
= synonyms: trip up
- to discover or come upon accidentally, suddenly, or unexpectedly
= example: to discover or come upon accidentally, suddenly, or unexpectedly
- to become aware of
- to be the catcher
= example: to be the catcher
- to catch up with and possibly overtake
= synonyms: overtake, catch up with
- to succeed in catching or seizing, especially after a chase
= synonyms: capture
- to hook or entangle
= example: to hook or entangle
= synonyms: hitch
- to cause to become accidentally or suddenly caught, ensnared, or entangled
- to spread or be communicated
= example: to spread or be communicated
- to reach with a blow or hit in a particular spot
= synonyms: get
- to take hold of so as to seize or restrain or stop the motion of
= synonyms: grab, take hold of
- to capture as if by hunting, snaring, or trapping
= synonyms: capture
- to take in and retain
= example: to take in and retain
- to attract and fix
= synonyms: get
- to apprehend and reproduce accurately
= synonyms: get
- to attract
= synonyms: entrance
- to reach in time
= example: to reach in time
= synonyms: make
- to suffer from the receipt of
= example: to suffer from the receipt of
= synonyms: get
- to perceive with the senses quickly, suddenly, or momentarily
= synonyms: pick up
- to see or watch
= example: to see or watch
= synonyms: watch, view, see, take in
- to hear, usually without the knowledge of the speakers
= synonyms: take in, overhear
- to perceive by hearing
= example: to perceive by hearing
= synonyms: get
- to get or regain something necessary, usually quickly or briefly
- to check oneself during an action
= example: to check oneself during an action
- to start burning
